Key Match Events: Sabonis was left open for a second three-point attempt after a missed shot.
Malik Monk was left open from three after a play where three Celtics players were focused on Sabonis and Lyles.
The Kings outrebounded the Celtics, with Sabonis alone grabbing as many offensive rebounds as the Celtics did.
Pre-Game Insights: The Kings used ball screens, pick-and-rolls, and handoffs to attack mismatches or get ahead of the Celtics' defense.
Jayson Tatum struggled against double teams and pressure, turning the ball over 8 times.
Jaylen Brown attacked Keon Ellis early in the game, making 8 out of 12 attempts in the paint.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics lacked seriousness and energy on the boards, especially from offensive rebounds.
The Celtics' pick-and-roll defense struggled, leading to easy shots for the Kings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings' defense created turnovers and protected defensive rebounds, ranking 6th in the league since Christmas.
DeMar DeRozan scored 12 points and delivered 4 assists in the fourth quarter, rising above the Celtics' collapse.
